quotes.quote: Don't worry when you are not recognized, but strive to be worthy of recognition.
Don't work for recognition, but do work worthy of recognition.
Don't do something for recognition, Do it out of kindness, do it because out of giving, it will make you whole and complete.
The craving for recognition is every artist's Achilles heel.
Recognition is not a scare resource. You can't use it up or run out of it.
Recognition of function always precedes recognition of being.
Recognition is the greatest motivator.
People may take a job for more money, but they often leave it for more recognition.
What every genuine philosopher (every genuine man, in fact) craves most is praise-although the philosophers generally call it  recognition'!
It is up to us to give ourselves recognition. If we wait for it to come from others, we feel resentful when it doesn't, and when it does, we may well reject it.
A pat on the back is only a few vertebrae removed from a kick in the pants, but is miles ahead in results.
When someone comes along who genuinely thanks us, we will follow that person a very long way.
In the arena of human life, the honors and rewards fall to those who show their good qualities in action.
A boss wants to pay for results, an employee wants recognition for effort. If a boss recognizes effort, they will get even better results.
Men want recognition of their work, to help them to believe in themselves.
I think it takes people to get to know you and the recognition comes over time.
By common consent of all the nations and all the ages the most valuable thing in this world is the homage of men, whether deserved or undeserved.
People always clap for the wrong things.
There's nothing greater in the world than when somebody on the team does something good, and everybody gathers around to pat him on the back.
There is nothing I need so much as nourishment for my Self Esteem.
The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.
Brains, like hearts, go where they are appreciated.
Every human being is trying to say something to others. Trying to cry out I am alive, notice me! Speak to me! Confirm that I am important, that I matter!!

It is important that you recognized your progress and take pride in your accomplishments. Share your achievements with others. Brag a little. The recognition and support of those around you is nurturing.
It's more than who you recognize. It's how you recognize. It's when. It's why.
Never miss an opportunity to say a word of congratulation upon anyone's achievement.
No matter how busy you are, you must take time to make the other person feel important.
Recognition is the most inexpensive, easy-to-use motivational technique available to management.
The only thing that happens overnight is recognition. Not talent.
Give recognition where it is due. Compliments stimulate more effort and desire to improve. Be generous with honest praising.
